intro: Sherbournia hapalophylla var. henrihuana, commonly known as the Henrihuana rockrose, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions of South America. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its compact form and dense foliage. The leaves are typically small, leathery, and covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, appearing in clusters during the warmer months. This plant thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
